title: Two Models - One Integration Crisis? Immigrant/Minority Conditions and Policy Options in France and Britain
abstractText:
In France and Britain, two purportedly opposing visions of immigrant integration - one based on universalism and citizenship verses one centred on anti-discrimination and multiculturalism seem to have produced common outcomes, or failures, indicated by equally poor socio-ecomonic and political conditions among ethnic minorities.

This set of workshops will interrograte the French and British models, outcomes, and policy options surrounding immigrant/ethnic minority integration. Participants will include academics, policy makers, local government representatives and NGOs (including migrant/ethnic minority associations). Workshop reports will be widely disseminated, and a research project proposal will be developed to explicate common and differential challenges of integration policy formation.
